Key Match Events: The Golden State Warriors started with a blowout 139-104 win over the Portland Trail Blazers
Steph Curry and Buddy Hield led the team with 17 points and 22 points respectively
The Warriors propped up a 62-50 lead at halftime
The Warriors took over in the second half with a 20-point lead heading into the fourth quarter
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams showcased intent and energy as a high-octane scoring contest ensued between the sides
Post-Match Reflections: The lack of floor balance and communication played a key role in Portland's loss
The visitors though will be pleased to have nailed most of their game plans early on in the season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Golden State Warriors opened their 2024-25 NBA season campaign with a blowout win
Steph Curry helped himself to a double-double with 17 points and 10 assists
Buddy Hield made a solid debut for his new team with 22 points
Others: The game was played at Moda Center
The Warriors' new acquisitions got into their groove early on in the second half
Scoot Henderson had 22 points off the bench for the Blazers
